gurmukhi: jYsy md pIAq n jwnIAY mrMmu qw ko pwCY mqvwro hoie CkY Ck jwiq hY
transliteration: Jaisay Mad Peeat N Jaaneeai Maranmu Taa Ko , Paachhai Matavaaro Hoi Chhakai Chhak Jaati Hai ?
translation: Just as a man drinking wine is unaware of its effect on him and he keeps consuming more till he falls unconscious.

gurmukhi: jYsy Bwir Bytq Bqwrih n Bydu jwnih auidq ADwn Awn ichin idKwq hY
transliteration: Jaisay Bhaari Bhaytat Bhataarahi N Bhaydu Jaanahi , Udit Adhaan Aan Chihani Dikhaat Hai ?
translation: Just as a wife making love with her husband is unaware of the effect at that time but it appears in the form of her pregnancy.

gurmukhi: kir pir mwnku n lwgq hY BwrI qol mol sMiKAw dmkn hyrq ihrwiq hY
transliteration: Kari Pari Maanaku N Laagat Hai Bhaaree Tola , Mol Sankhiaa Damakan Hayrat Hiraati Hai ?
translation: Just as one feels no weight of a diamond on one's hand but when sold, amazes all with the money that it brings forth.

gurmukhi: qYsy gur AMmiRq bcn suin mwnY isK jwnY mihmw jau suK swgr smwq hY ]374]
transliteration: Taisay Gur Anmrit Bachan Souni Maanai Sikha , Jaanai Mahimaa Jau Soukh Saagar Samaat Hai ?374?
translation: So does a Sikh of the Guru listens to the elixir-like sermon of the True Guru and adopts it with mind, words and deeds. He then realises its greatness and merges in the Lord-the ocean of all comforts and peace. (A Naam practitioner only knows the ecstasy
